intro: Calandrinia leucopogon, commonly known as the silverleaf portulaca, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, making it suitable for arid and semi-arid environments. Its ability to store water in its leaves allows it to survive in dry conditions. Calandrinia leucopogon is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and low maintenance requirements.
